metadata.Title: CVE-2016-0665 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Compliant (bionic) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Unspecified vulnerability in Oracle MySQL 5.6.28 and earlier and 5.7.10 and earlier allows local users to affect availability via vectors related to Security: Encryption.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-0665` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libmysqlclient20 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-client-core-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-server-core-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-source-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-testsuite - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
mysql-testsuite-5.7 - 5.7.11-0ubuntu6
No subscription required

criterions.comment: mysql-5.7 package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '5.7.11-0ubuntu6').
